Description: Lip and body sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery cup (type C); concave lip; glazed inside and out.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), North and west of Well B (Hogarth Site 35), found by 'Bedawi boys who search the rubbish heaps' (Hogarth 1898-9, 31)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Hogarth explains that this sherd was found north or west of the well marked 35 in the Hellenion by Bedouin boys. See Hogarth (1898/1899), p. 31.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 55, no. 77)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 702, no. 600, pl. 26.12)
Hogarth 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, A. Site and Buildings (p. 31, no. 77)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1670)
Höckmann & Möller 2006 / The Hellenion at Naukratis: Questions and Observations (p. 19, no. 24)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
